The presence of health insurance exchang: which allow individuals and small businesses to purchase private-sector health insurance.
The provision of affordability subsidies: where lower-income individuals and families can receive government assistance to help them pay for health insurance premiums.
The lack of cost: containment provisions in the Massachusetts plan, which has been criticized for not addressing the issue of controlling healthcare costs.
The differences in financing between the: with the Massachusetts plan heavily relying on federal matching funds, while the federal law imposes taxes on various healthcare-related industries to generate revenue.
